alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 16 at 5:14PM MDT until June 16 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... South central Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Bernalillo County in central New Mexico... * Until 545 PM MDT. * At 512 PM MDT, an area of dust created by dry showers was over western Albuquerque and will spread into the remainder of the metro area. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 146 and 162. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 215 and 234. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Bernalillo, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Cabezon, Vista Hills, Rio Rancho City Center, Paradise Hills and Northern Meadows. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust creates reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
